author: The Associated Press
title: Salort-Pons takes over as Detroit Institute of Arts director
text:
Salort-Pons takes over as Detroit Institute of Arts director The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story DETROIT 
A Detroit Institute of Arts official credited with playing a key role in the museum's strategic planning process is set to begin his tenure as its 11th director. 
Salvador Salort-Pons assumes his new roles and responsibilities at the museum Thursday. He previously worked as the museum's executive director of collection strategies and information, as well as the director of its European Art Department. 
Salort-Pons signed a five-year contract and will be paid a $375,000 base salary in his first year. He'll be given graduated raises each year, bringing his salary to $475,000 in 2020, the final year of the deal. 
He succeeds Graham W. J. Beal, who retired as director in June. Beal helped to protect the museum's collection from possible sale during the city's bankruptcy and spearheaded a $158 million overhaul of the cultural attraction. Related content
